result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon K Hall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 7/1/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 7/1/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

*Restitution is set at zero.*

No drivers license suspension.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence. Huber to apply for work, work crew and AODA treatment.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon K Hall

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon K Hall in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 30 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply`for work, work crew and AODA treatment.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 7/1/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 7/1/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
-No drivers license suspension
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court, defendant Brandon K Hall not in court, in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record. Defendant NOT produced. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Case adjourned to branch 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon K Hall in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Brandon K Hall in custody.  David Behm for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing and no drugs without a valid prescription.

Defendant Brandon K Hall in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Brandon K Hall in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 06-01-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
